title.narrative: Strengthening food security and sovereignty of organized women in 8 cooperatives in northern Nicarag

description.narrative: This project will work with 8 communities in northern Nicaragua to firmly establish the production of sunflowers and the production of sunflower oil there and also to support seed banks in the same 8 communities to ensure that local farmers have adequate traditional seed supplies in the face of increasing uncertainty related to climate change. This proposal will be implemented with the local organizational structures at the community level and several different networks, including the network of seed growers, and the management of the Las Diosas plant where the seeds will be milled. This proposal will also strengthen cooperative governance. We have been in previous discussions about the actions contemplated in this proposal as it is part of the economic and organizational empowerment strategy that the Between Women Foundation (FEM) is working on to increase autonomy in the basic food supply of women including corn, beans and sunflower oil. This project also responds to the guidelines of the Strategic Plan (R1. Established agroecological systems that contribute to the management of alternative models of peasant economy and contribute to the food security and sovereignty of peasant women). The proposal will be implanted in 8 communities in Northern Nicaragua.
